history.origin: Written in Naples during the late XVII century by Carlo De Lellis, a Neapolitan erudite historian and archivist.
history.provenance: The manuscript was acquired by Camillo Minieri Riccio during the XIX century and later by the famous historian Bartolomeo Capasso.
history.acquisition: The manuscript is now kept by Società Napoletana di Storia Patria.

abstract.p: The manuscript is composed of three different collections of regests of charters kept by Neapolitan monasteries in the late 17th century. The last section, the one to be encoded, consists of regests of charters issued from the 7th to the 17th century and kept in San Sebastiano of Naples in the late 17th century.

calendar.p: The indiction system is a 15-year cycle used as a chronological unit in ancient Rome and adopted in some medieval kingdoms. In early medieval southern Italy the Byzantine was in force: the year began on September 1st and ended on August 31st of the following year.

projectDesc.p: The aim of the project is the encoding of the regests collected in Notamento and that refer to the charters issued until 1199.

In addition to the compilation of the teiHeader with the information in possession at the current time, the edition provides the original to be encoded in jpeg image format through the use of the facsimile element. Given the nature of the source, which is a collection of abstracts independent of each other, each surface element has more zone elements nested, so that each zone could be linked to its own transcription through the use of start attribute and the xml:id assigned to each abstract transcribed in the body(N1, N2, N3 etc) and to the pb elements (for those cases where the start of a new page does not correspond to the start of an abstract). The edition also provides the use of standOff element, within which the following elements are nested: listOrg, listPerson, listPlace, listRelation, listEvent. In listOrg, all the organisations are distinguished by the type attribute. In listPerson grops and distinguishes the various personalities acting in the deeds. Unfortunately, many – if not all – of them are anonymous, so it was not possible for the moment to enrich each person with further information; listRelation is thought to clarify the relationships between the persons, taking care to specify through the source attribute the source of that information. The use of listPlace was intended to provide more information about places (toponyms and micro-toponyms mentioned). When possible, a geolocation reference of the places was provided when their correspondence with is modern places. listEvent consists of summaries of what is expressed in the individual regests in text. Although it does not add any information to what is already indicated in the regests, it might be useful in prevision of historical research on this source, to provide English summaries of the contents of the regests with appropriate references to people, lands, places. the text consists of more p elements nested within, with an xml:id and an n corresponding to the identification number of each regest (encoded in the text with the idno element). All the information that could be obtained from the regests are ancoded through the use of the elements persName, placeName, orgName and date. In addition, the fw element recurs on two occasions, in order to provide maximum fidelity to the source.

samplingDecl.p: Samples of the first thirteen regests of charters issued until 1199.

normalization.p: All latin abbrevions are presented in the extended form.
The transcription of the text follows modern criteria, such as: modern use of capital letters, separation of words, distinction between "u" and "v", use of modern punctuation.

The personal names listed in listPerson have been normalized in two forms: an Italian normalization and a Latin one in the nominative case. Only the names of the Byzantine emperors reported here have a double normalization in the Italian and English form. Instead, all the organizations in listOrg have been listed with the Italian name only. As regards places listed in listPlace, normalization into Italian name has been adopted for those places for which identification with modern locations is certain, for all other locations we preferred to report only the Latin form. Languages are specified through the use of the attribute xml:lang

stdVals.p: In each regest transcribed in text there are different dating methods from those currently in force in Europe, for this reason date element involves the attribute when-custom for encoding the date as reported in the regest, but also an attriute when which presents a normalised version of the same date. For those cases in which it is not possible to date back to a precise date, the use of the notBefore and notAfter attributes has been adopted.

body.p: Die 28 mensis novembris indictione 15 Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno 57 sed et Constantino fratre eius Magno Imperatore anno 54. Gregorius Pintore et Anna uterini germana, filii quidam Petri e quidam Ruta iugalium, donant Supraxie uterine germane eorum coniugi Ioannis Lancia Longa quandam terram sitam in loco qui nominatur Canditi. Numero 192, olim .M..

Die 8 mensis aprilis indictione 13, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Romano Magno Imperatore anno primo. Maria honesta femina, filia quidam domini Stephani de Turre, vendit domino Leoni corrigiam unam de terra sita in Lama, iuxta bona quidam domini Anastasii Cacapice, iuxta bona monasterii Sancti Marcellini, monasterii Sancte Marie et terram de hominibus de sol et luna in loco Lama, subtus Caba, quam terram vendit cum consensu domini Aligerni viri sui. Numero 193, olim CCCXXXV.

Die 3 mensis magii indictione nona, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno sexagesimo 6Basil II died in December 1025, so the reference to his domination in the dating of the document is an error. sed et Constantino fratre suo Magno Imperatore anno 63. Pirrus qui nominatur Stullicula, habitator loci Pumiliani ad Arcoram dudum aqueductus, vendit terram sitam a Pratora, iuxta bona episcopii Sancti Felicis Nolani, et illorum de Siculis et Ioannes
Ioannes filii quidam Leonis Pappaasini. Numero 194.

Die 21 mensis decembris indictione 5, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno 47 sed et Constantino fratre suo Magno Imperatore anno 44. Petrus de loco Muniani vendit petiam terre domino Stephano Infelliore, iuxta bona domini Iohannes Brancatii et domini Ioannes Capice. Numero 196 olim .K.

Die 11 mensis martii indictione 9, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno 6 sed et Niceforio et Constantino Magnis Imperatoribus anno 3. Gregorius Gratia Dei piscopus sedis Neapolitane Ecclesie convenit cum monasterio Sanctorum Sergii et Bacchi, congregato in monasterio Sanctorum Theodori et Sebastani, de petia terre que vocantur Cicanellum, posita in Quarto Maiore in gualdo. Et in subscriptione Gregorius episcopus. Numero 197, olim XXXXII.

Die 7 mensis martii indictione 5, imperante Domino nostro Constantino Perfitogenito Magno Imperatore anno 39 sed et Romano Magno Imperatore eius filio anno 2. Stephanus, filius quidam Ioannis, disposit in beneficium Leonis, filii quidam domini Boni, et Stephani et tradit ei bona posita in Quarto Maiora necnon pro anima sua monasterio Sanctorum Theodori et Sebastiani et bona sunt que vocantur de illa balnearia. Et inter testes Leo filius domini Marini, Gregorius filius domini Ioanni, Ioannes filius domini Gregorii. Numero 198, olim XXXXI.

Die 9 martii indictione 3, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno 30 sed et Constantino Magno Imperatore fratre eius anno 27. Stephanus, filius quidam Leonis, et Gregorius, hoc est genitor et filius, vendunt petiam terre coniugi Martini germani sui, habitatori in loco qui nominatur Galloro, petiam terre sitam in loco Nepiliani iuxt bona ecclesia Sancti Severi. Numero 199, olim LXXXVIIII.

Die 20 mensis februarii indictione 13, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno 10 sed et Niciforio et Constantino magnis Imperatoribus anno 7 *** vendit domino Ioanni Ferrario, filio quidam domini Cicini, petiam de terra sita in loco Anglone, iuxta bona Aligerni, monasterii Sanctorum Nicandri et Marciani et illorum Saviniani, posita in Campo de Miana. Numero 200, olim CLXXXVII.

Tempore Domini nostri Guillelmi Regis Sicilie. Petrus qui nominatur Montanino convenit pro venditione cuiusdem terre in loco qui nominatur Pischinula, iuxta bona Sancti Sebastiani. Numero 201, olim CXXXXVIIII.

Die 14 februarii indictione 5, imperante Domino nostro Romano Magno imperatore anno 17 sed et Basilio Magno Imperatore eius filio anno 2. Marinus filius quidam domini Sergii, pro parte domina Drose eius coniugis, donat monasterio Sanctorum Tehodori et Sebastiani petiam terre postiam in loco qui nominatur Giniolum, pro anima sua et Anne coniugis sue. Numero 202, olim CCCLXXVIIII.

Die 9 septembris indictione 10, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno imperatore anno 7 sed et Niciforio et Constantino Magnis Imperatoribus anno 4. Maria filia quidam domini Ioannis, relicta domini Leonis, donat et tradit pro redemptione anime sue monasterio Sanctorum Sergii et Bacchi, quod nunc congregatum est in monasterio Sanctorum Theodori et Sebastiani, petiam terre positam in Quarto Maiore. Numero 203, olim CCCXXVIIII.

Die 4 augusti indictione 5, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Romano Magno Imperatore anno 17 sed et Basilio Magno Imperatore eius filio anno 2. Quidam ingressus est monasterium Sanctorum Theodori et Sebastiani et promittit regulam observare et donat dicto monasterio petiam terre positam in Quarto Maiore una cum balneuria et cum pischina, iuxta bona Leonis filii domini Gregorii et ecclesie Sancte Iuliane. Numero 204, olim CCCCCXXXII

Die 6 novembris indictione 15, Neapoli, imperante Domino nostro Basilio Magno Imperatore anno 57 sed et Constantino fratre eius Magno Imperatore anno 54. Gregorius et Leo filii quidam Sergii Ferrarii donant monasterio Sanctorum Sergii et Bacchi, quod nunc congregatum est in monasterio Sanctorum Theodori et
Sebastiani qui appellatur Casapicta situm in viridario, petiam terre sitam in Fracta Maiore in loco Lancea Asina iuxta bona de illis Ciminula, Leonis filii quidam Ioannis Catonzi, heredum Petri de Bona et ibi dominus Marinus de Turre filius quidam domini Ioannis, cum mensura mensurata ad passum ferreum Sancte Neapolitane Ecclesie. Numero 205, olim CCLXXXV.
